website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for cooler climates with high moisture and moderate sun exposure.
pros: Convenient zippers in all the right places
Built-in vents let air escape during moderate winds
cons: May run small, so be sure to measure carefully

customer_reviews.title: Great cover if installed correctly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cover for my trailer to protect it from the elements. I padded all sharp corners and edges. The cover was fairly easy to install with two people. It fit well, I recommend ordering a cover that fits the size of your trailer, don't order a size bigger. It's been on all winter in the wind, rain, snow and sleet. No tares or worn areas. The key to these covers are to protect them from sharp edges and corners and a proper fit on your trailer.
customer_reviews.author: AvgConsumer57

customer_reviews.title: Hole
customer_reviews.text: After considerable research selecting the right cover for our conditions (wet PNW), I was happy to find this cover at the price point we wanted. Reviews were all very good. Unfortunately when we opened the box, and pulled open the saran wrap film, we found a hole in the cover. Had to have been made when it was getting wrapped. So very disappointing. We decided to keep it since it was scheduled to rain for the following week and we wanted to put the cover on while the whole trailer was dry. Thank goodness for duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Failed earlier than previous covers
customer_reviews.text: I bought this (my third) ADCO cover in March of 2018 and installed it in April. When by the site where I store may trailer last month (June 2019) and found the cover disintegrated. This particular one will not hold up in the Florida sun and wind. I think perhaps the previous ADCO covers I had were premium version because they lasted for 2 1/2 - 3 years. Even those started looking weathered and had some tears after 18-mponths to 2 years. This one last just 14 months and the entire roof portion is in shreds. So if you live in the deep south, probably not the cover for you unless you're willing to replace it annually.
customer_reviews.author: K Gipe

customer_reviews.title: Bummed it only lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 2 of these covers for my travel trailer in the last 5 years of ownership. The first one lasted 3.5 years, that seemed acceptable. The next one I purchased in (Aug '18) and 13 months later (Sept '19) it's already torn. Even though they we're both the same model number, I felt from the beginning that the lastest one just wasn't weathering as well as the first. Anything sharp or pokey was covered beforehand. Our northern CA climate is fairly mild, no extreme heat, cold, snow or high wind. Looks like I'll have to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't even last a year!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the 211"-24' cover for less than a year for my I-Go RB-210, and several large openings have appeared on the roof. Anywhere that a protrusion occurs in the roof (vent covers, AC unit, etc.) a hole has appeared with the same dimensions. This is not good. The cover should not wear through in less than a year. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: hilndr44

customer_reviews.title: buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: The top of cover disintegrated in less than one year. Adco warranty specialist said this NOT the cover for sun. So do not buy if you live in california or anywhere with sun. Under warranty they would send us another but we have to now pay shipping and they will not warranty the new cover. They offered an upgrade for more $ and shipping, but will not give a warranty. We will buy from another company. The 2 year waranty is a joke. Contact the company directly before buying to be sure you are getting what you want. My warranty paper reads differently than the warranty listed her. it is only a one time replacement the company says.
customer_reviews.author: bubbles

customer_reviews.title: Great cover.  Pain to install for one person.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great RV cover. However, it's nearly impossible to install for one person, during windy conditions and using a step ladder. This cover is essentially a parachute when in windy conditions.. Additionally, make sure you pad every sharp corner with something. I used painters tape. Cinch the binding clips down to avoid the cover rubbing and moving. The weighted throws for the under clips are nice but you need to have an clear throw. I had weeds and grass in my way. Overall, this cover looks great but is not the easiest for one person to install. I would recommend using two or more people to install.
customer_reviews.author: N/A

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this one month and two days ago. Our ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this one month and two days ago. Our trailer wasn't delivered to us until a month after we purchased the cover. Tried to put this on our 28.4 foot trailer. Way too small. Nowhere in the ad did it say that you should get three or four feet bigger than your actual trailer. We have heard you want them to fit just right so they don't flap in the wind and wear your decals off your unit. Now we're out all this money.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Aubert

customer_reviews.title: excellent cover
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Keystone passport well except the access panel is right on the edge of the RV door could be a few inches further to pen camper door easier if necessary to get into camper during storage. Purchased from Amazon warehouse deals and very satisfied. After the first winter I uncovered the camper and it looked great no mildew dirt or abrasion from the wind rubbing the cover against it. Just put it on for the second winter and it still looks like new. I used tennis balls on the gutters instead of the little bags which tend to fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Scot

customer_reviews.title: Ripped while installing for the first time
customer_reviews.text: Given the price, I wasn’t expecting a lifetime of use out of this cover, but I was certainly expecting it to last beyond the first season! My husband put his hand right threw the corner while putting it on the trailer for THE FIRST TIME EVER. Don’t get me wrong, my husband is a strong capable man, but he’s not the Hulk. It’s not likely that he underestimated his own strength by that much and put his hand through it using brute force. Really wanted to love this cover... The price was right, it looked sharp, and was exactly what we were looking for, but I don’t think it will survive the season since it’s already torn.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Courier

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy used.
customer_reviews.text: I appreciated the package was delivered on time. I like how it fits the camper. The door access zipper is in a good location. Very easy to secure into place. I am very disappointed in the lack of honesty in the write up of the product. I purchased this item with the understanding it was used but in very good condition. It is not the case. Duck tape on three locations, big red spots on the roof section of the cover and only received three of the four gutter spout covers. The cost to send it back is very disappointing. I saved approximately sixty bucks. I will pay the extra next time. Not interested in buying used again from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Chip Ahoy

customer_reviews.title: Tears upon arrival!
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with 2 tears in the material, found them once the cover was on the camper. Material is very flimsy with a paper like feel. I have no doubt it will not last this winter season, we would have been better off buying a large tarp, but due to impending weather we have no choice but to leave it in place at this point. Very disappointed! Cheap cheap cheap!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dragonfly75

customer_reviews.title: Small Flaw
customer_reviews.text: Product seems really good except we placed the little booties over the rain cutters and a good cust oc wind came through and pulled 3 of the 6 off and now we have a hole in the cover because of this. Update: Evan though it is built for outside it doesn't stand up to the weather, we took it off this year and it feel apart.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Good initial impression
customer_reviews.text: Just received and installed it today so this is a initial quality only review. 21-24" version fit my 23" camper length-wise quite well. Do wish the cover was 6" taller though as it barely covers the bottom of the camper. Only other complaint is that the buckles seem a bit weak. Two popped apart when I was tightening the straps. In a sense it may prevent you from over tightening, but do wish they were a little more rugged. Will update the review after the winter to see how it held up. Material seems pretty good and thick though so hoping it works out well.
customer_reviews.author: caa40y

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed that this has already torn and is falling off my camper. Really thought for the price that it would have lasted more than two winters. It's now just a piece of junk to haul to the dump. I got 6 winters out of the one I had before buying this one... This one started to tear the first fime it was put on...should have packed it up and sent it back then. Called ADCO customer service since it isunder the2 year warranty. They said they would send an email with claim form...they did not bother to send it.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Strong

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 1.5 years. Virginia UV rays destroyed it
customer_reviews.text: Previous cover I had was a ADCO Tyvec in New Jersey and DC Area. It lasted 4 years before the material (Tyvec) on top deteriorated to the point it fell apart. That's respectable in my book for the cost. This one was an Aqua Shed-not Tyvec. It didn't last even 1.5 years. Not only did it rip easier at the corners, but the material was brittle and deteriorated. It wasn't as much the wind, as it was the UV that seems to have destroyed this one. I had a feeling when i bought it that it wouldn't last as long as the Tyvec. It just felt thinner all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: PRC

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cover when I ordered my trailer so it sat in the box for 5 months until my trailer arrived. When I finally installed it, I noticed a buckle was missing on the front flap. This buckle is supposed to be stitched in place, but was obviously missed. I called ADCO CS immediately to see about getting just a buckle and was told the covers were manufactured in China and they have NO parts available. I was told I could submit a 1 time warranty claim, but I feel the cover was defective from the beginning. All this headache over a 10 cent buckle. Will not order from this company anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for about a month
customer_reviews.text: Be very weary if you plan to use this cover in an environment with any kind of wind. Shortly after purchasing and installing this cover it shredded in the first winter storm we had here in Denver this year. The cover appeared to relatively sound however it was unable to withstand its first moderate winter storm. It literally split right down the middle length wise of the trailer. The cover was properly strapped and cinched down and tight so wind should not have destroyed this brand new cover. Unfortunately ADCO does not warrant against wind (as I just read). This one is a hard to believe as I can't see any environment being completely wind free...
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Workman

customer_reviews.title: Save your money buy tarps rather than this cover
customer_reviews.text: We bought this some time back and didn't use it. We put it on last year and during installation it ripped a bit at the bottom. Then the first storm we had, which wasn't significant we found more rips. We live in Florida and today we found it laying on the ground totally disintegrated. If you live in a mild climate and have shade, it might work for you. We won't be buying another cover anytime soon..I rather use tarps. This was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: R/G P

customer_reviews.title: Had it been ripping at locations where things like ac units or other obstructions or sharp corners were ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in May of 2016 lasted until July 2017 when it literally started to disintegrated. There was no saving it as we pulled it off ripping with the slightest touch. Had it been ripping at locations where things like ac units or other obstructions or sharp corners were on the roof, but it was totally in tact there. I will not buy another cover from ADCO. Very poor product.
customer_reviews.author: RAI

customer_reviews.title: Protects My RV in the Texas Sun!
customer_reviews.text: Good design, worth the money. This type is not designed to be waterproof but it offers a lot of protection from the sun and heat. Very good fit with lots of properly placed straps. Comes with its own storage bag. I would rate it 5 stars if it were a more durable material. It is thin and you have to take care not to rip it during install. It does come with some adhesive patch material for those holes that wear through or small tears. Also includes gutter "socks" that cover the sharp gutter edges.
customer_reviews.author: Safeman

customer_reviews.title: Budget product that doesn't fare well in the sun.
customer_reviews.text: Installed Oct 2018 for storage of our trailer. Good fit, attractive cover. Went to remove it last week (after approx. 9 months of being installed and undisturbed), found the top to be deteriorated and crumbling in my hands. Ended up tearing a large hole in the top trying to pull the cover up from the sides. So for $250 we enjoyed about 9 months of use. Clearly does not hold up well in the AZ sun; do not recommend for use in exposed environments. Will need to look elsewhere for a more durable, sun-resistant product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Top does not hold up.
customer_reviews.text: Not good, will not purchase again. Installed cover November 2018. By January 2020 top of cover began to tear and deteriorate, sides were ok. This was the 3rd cover purchased over about 6 years from different manufacturers. Usually the sides deteriorate before top and last about 2 years. This had the shortest life of any covers purchased. Live in Tallahassee, Florida.
customer_reviews.author: Wayfarer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year at most
customer_reviews.text: This cover is not made with good material. The first time I installed it, one of the straps tore off the cover when trying to tighten it. This didn't take much effort to tear. After a year it was obvious that the cover was damaged from UV because it was easy to tear with no effort. My hand would go right through it. Very little effort to tear this material. One year and it is now in a dumpster. What a waste of money. I am going back to using a big blue tarp from Harbor freight.
customer_reviews.author: BillofOhio

customer_reviews.title: Protect your RV
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my RV travel trailer about 3 weeks now. And unfortunately I have to parked outside without a shade or a roof over it. The best way to protect my RV is a cover. I choose ADCO is because it’s recommended by the dealer who sold us the RV. It took me and my wife about 15 to 20 minutes to cover our RV. (Someone has to be on the roof) also you will need a ladder to move and adjust the corners. After you finish adjusting the cover then it’s very easy to tie down everything with the straps.
customer_reviews.author: Yuchin Chen

customer_reviews.title: nice looking but after being used as it was designed
customer_reviews.text: nice looking but after being used as it was designed ,its rotted out all over just from sun exsposure.this is only good for temporary use in any weather.absolutely has desinegrated under sun exposure in six months of outdoor use.complete waste of money.read the other reviews they say pretty much the same.cover will only make it through their warrANTY PERIOD IF YOU USE IT PART TIME INDOOR /MAYBE SOME OUTDOOR USE.. I FEEL FRAUDED BY THE ADD THEY USE TO SELL IT. A REFUND WOULD BE APPROPRIATE,USUALLY THEY SEND YOU ANOTHER ,WHAT GOOD IS THAT,JUST NEED TO MOVE ON AND GET A REAL DURable cover.amazon.com could not help where this item was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: acZdc

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably good quality good looking.
customer_reviews.text: Well this is a year late but I ordered the 31' 7" to 34 ft cover!! I didn't use it last year as we used the TT all year. This year is different as we all know and we're storing the TT so we unboxed the cover ready to install and under the "shipping order label" that is clearly marked 31-34 ft But -on the Original BOX it is printed CLEARLY that it is for a 26' to 28'. Well that's not going to work. Anyway wish I'd opened the box last year, this SUCKS!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Holes in first season of use on rounded corners! SMH!
customer_reviews.text: If you want a cover that may last one season, then this bad boy is for you! That is if you like buying new covers every year. This is literally 1/2 a star above a paper trash bag left in the rain. These folks are suppose to be the leaders in RV covers? I think not. I'm not sure how this company sleeps at night unless their business model is to take one customer at a time knowing they won't come back. Listen, I know it's not the top of the line, but for the money it should last at least 5 years. You got me once ADCO but never again.
customer_reviews.author: John Arsenault

customer_reviews.title: 10 months only
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this cover to protect my rv’s newly painted front cap from any future fading from the sun. It lasted 10 months. Cover started to rip (tear) after about 6 inches of heavy wet snow. Once snow was gone and dried up, 1 hour of heavy winds ripped the top right down the middle of the rv top. When removed ruined cover you could feel how the material of the cover was dry rotting. I’m sure the cover would not have lasted until the spring or another beating from the sun. Warranty does not cover weather related damage.
customer_reviews.author: AMCS7

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A JOKE!!!
customer_reviews.text: What a joke, started off with unwrapping of the cover to find small holes in the cover. We were desperate to get our 2018 26’ Grey Wolf RV covered, so we continued for the next hour trying to carefully pull the very thin cover over the trailer. We finally have the trailer covered only to find that the front tension strap has been sown on upside down and has the wrong strap attached to it!!!!!!!! 🤬 Sooooooooooo disappointing!!!!!!!!! Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Sires

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover, a little more snug than I would like though
customer_reviews.text: Nice, includes a separate cover for the a/c but it was too small for mine. It also comes with a storage bag for when the cover is not in use. My trailer “cabin” or “body” measures 29’-4”. This just fits, with some carefully measured forceful umph. I’m sure it’ll stretch a little, which I will be thankful for. The underside straps and clips are great except I broke off the last one that I cinched down. I will try to sew it back on. Labeled “front “ and “rear” which is nice. Overall I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: That is not too bad for being up here in the great northwest
customer_reviews.text: This is the third ADCO trailer cover I have bought. The last one I had lasted three years having the trailer covered for about 7 months of the year. That is not too bad for being up here in the great northwest. I have a 23 foot long trailer and I went with the 24 to 26 cover this time to have a little extra room for when the wind is whipping thru. It looks like this cover is made better than the previous covers I have had. I think I will get four winters out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: dries quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cover. We use it on our Outback 28. Only caution is if you have the drip gutters at the top end of your RV, you will want to do a thorough job of covering them up with bubble wrap or similar. I covered 4, and being in a rush, the bubble wrap eventually slipped away and the gutter eventually poked a hole in the cover. I think I can repair, but overall quite satisfied. Have seen no mildew, etc, under cover.
customer_reviews.author: Bill in VA

customer_reviews.title: This item is not even minimally water resistant.
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with previous adco rv cover. (it lasted 6 years). I purchased this model expecting maybe less longevity but still great protection for my rv. I realize it was designed for moderate locations but the first time it rained the entire trailer and portions of the cover were wet. Love the product design but spend the extra $100.00 and get the upgraded tan version of this product. Unfortunately I didn't find this out until after the return window closed.! Painful,wet lesson learned!
customer_reviews.author: Diana S.

customer_reviews.title: These are not cheap and this is not want they should look like when you first take them out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my in-laws at Thanksgiving. We just put this on their trailer yesterday and I am concerned how this will hold up. I found a couple spots where the stitching is already coming out and there was a hole already in it. These are not cheap and this is not want they should look like when you first take them out of the box. If it wasn't for the fact that we needed to get the trailer covered now I would have returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Grover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and did the trick.
customer_reviews.text: Fit well on my 30ft keystone 28rsds. Its been on for a little over a month and no issues! I seen some reviews and I can say I haven't had the ripping or fading problems but I also live in a colder region.It went on fairly easy by myself. I laid it out on the ground used my ladder to get on top slung it over. the included strap weigh made getting underneath a breeze. I was going to order wheel covers but this cover does a decent job and covering them.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Romonovich

customer_reviews.title: Have had this a couple of years/it has held up well
customer_reviews.text: I like this product! Unfortunately for us a tree landed on our camper and cover right we purchased the cover. The cover wasn't covered in the loss, so I sewed up all the little tears. It still works great. It looks really good, too. Tie downs were sturdy, fit was great. I would highly recommend to others. In the future, I would probably order slightly bigger. It fit's well, but I think it would be easier to put on if it was a bit bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Iluvjeeps

customer_reviews.title: Great cover
customer_reviews.text: Had used Cover-craft covers to cover my Vette , so I was familiar with these covers.. Its a great cover because it breathes., and resists water.. Fairly easy to install.. I'm 66 and did it myself.. Make sure you secure the drain gutters guards .. They give you little bags that tie, but I secured mine with duck tape.. And I got the smallest recommended size on the chart for my trailer.. You don't want too much slack so the wind doesn't grab it and tear it.. For the price, you cant go wrong..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... of the box and found it very cheaply made poor buckle workmanship on the buckles and poor stitching on ...
customer_reviews.text: When I received the order of my new RV cover I was very surprised when I took it out of the box and found it very cheaply made poor buckle workmanship on the buckles and poor stitching on the seams that came apart when I installed it on my RV had to return the item for a new one still disappointed on the quality. I don't recommend this RV cover to anyone poor quality for an RV cover
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hearon

customer_reviews.title: Fits good, but it was broke..
customer_reviews.text: Broke. We didn't realize until we got it all the way on. It fits our camper good (20' without tongue), but we had to go buy straps to finish the job... 2 of the clips for the straps underneath the camper were crushed but they were wound up and had rubber bands on them, so we didn't see it until we were trying to secure the cover down.
customer_reviews.author: GlenFam2010

customer_reviews.title: Great looking cover to protect your RV from the elements
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever had to de-oxidize and polish an entire RV you'll wish you had one of these to start with. Its a little awkward to install the first time but it gets easier. Adco was also very thoughtful and included lots of extras to make sure it was simple process. Note: Be careful not to yank the fabric over your RV components as the fabric can and will tear. Verdict? Its a well made and fashionable cover overall but time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: 5280 Busa

customer_reviews.title: Nice cover, looks good
customer_reviews.text: This cover seems to be nicely made for the price. You really need to read the instructions and cover sharp edges. It comes with bags to cover your gutter spouts. I used some plastic insulation. All the straps that it comes with make it a nice fit. I have a 24' camper so I bought the 24.1 - 26' cover. Glad I went slightly big. Thanks to helpful reviews on this site. I will see how it holds up to Pennsylvania winters.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Cover
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and quality of this cover. It was very easy to install on our 28 foot travel trailer and the price was much lower than other stores.
customer_reviews.author: CutEpie

customer_reviews.title: Fits our 29 foot camper very well and keeps it looking like-new!
customer_reviews.text: I wish the whole cover was made out of the top material. We end up replacing this cover every year and a half maybe, because the sides get very weak and tear easily after a lot of exposure. The top is much more durable. All-in-all though... I would recommend covering your camper with something like this as our camper still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty JayDog

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cover in the Fall of 2016 for our travel trailer. It did not even last one winter. We left the trailer outside at a near by campground for the winter. When I went out last week to take the camper home the cover has fallen apart. Apparently the local squirrels love the fabric. They made several large holes in the cover. When I got on top of the trailer I discovered the fabric had split down the middle about 6 feet. The cover is beyond repair. Next year I won't bother with a cover when I put the trailer away for the winter.
customer_reviews.author: msmith_lpc

customer_reviews.title: trying it out - 2 months in.
customer_reviews.text: It's been on my camper for about 2 months and so far so good. It took about an hour to put on and I used a ladder instead of walking on my camper. I had one snap that was broken - guessing it was a defect, but I just tied the strap in a knot. I also went around the camper with box wrap (like saran wrap) to keep the cover from flapping in our windy neighborhood. If this doesn't hold up I may just buy a large plastic tarp and wrap with the box wrap - that stuff is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is Primary concern, extras were cool
customer_reviews.text: The throw pads n snaps mAke installation easy, just throw over, the hook to bottom and throw under. I criss cross end straps n snaps. Fit was great, not sloppy for my 22 ft trailer, pulled it over tire, bumper n ladder in back, over lp bottles in front. Cut out for entry door is flexible enough to fit my rv just fine. Colors are sharp. Neighbor asked me the next day where i got mine and what brand....he was gonna order one. I bought tennis balls n put them on gutter spouts...made this work great
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shockley

customer_reviews.title: Overall its a good cover. Better than sun rain wind ice and ...
customer_reviews.text: You may want to opt for the heavier duty version if you live in Michigan. It is difficult to protect every sharp edge, and sooner or later will get tears in areas you didnt realize were sharp. We just duct tape inside and out where that happens. Overall its a good cover. Better than sun rain wind ice and snow beating on it all winter and beats a tarp. Carefull when putting it on, I ended up stepping on vents that had to be replaced because I couldnt see them. Nothing to do with the cover, but lapse of judgment by me, the installer.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Boy RV

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in the quality and how long it actually lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March of 2017 and this review is in November 2017. I live in San Diego, so the weather is mostly 70-90 degrees. How about the roof middle seam already teared. I also had a couple straps ripped from the actual canvas and by the ladder. I went to remove it today and it left a lot of gray/white powder from the canvas. I honestly thought I would get minimum 2 years out of it. I just got 8 months use of it. I'm disappointed in the quality and how long it actually lasted. It's not like I live in Phoenix where it's 110+, then I would understand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money for a better cover...
customer_reviews.text: So if you Live in an area with no wind I guess this would be ok, but make sure you re-enforce the bottom corners... After only a couple of months on my trailer this cover is already tearing... This cover will not last a year....not a good buy. I just wanted a cover to keep sun off my trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Perfect pat

customer_reviews.title: Tore in Half in first thunderstorm
customer_reviews.text: I chose this cover to cover my bumper pull bunkhouse. After reading the reviews, I decided it was worth it to buy this cover as it is rated so high. Clearly, this cover was not intended to standup to a West Texas thunderstorm. The cover tore across the middle of the top all the way down the length of the trailer. I awoke to a giant flapping tarp that is now a TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY! I would not recommend this cover if you live anywhere with actual weather. I have not yet contacted the company as I was on travel when this occurred. I will be contacting them ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not for Pacific Northwest!
customer_reviews.text: This was the wrong style cover for the rainy and windy Pacific Northwest. I will opt for the Tyvek roof version for my next purchase. Several wear holes appeared after only one winter. Overall I like the product/brand and all the nice features. My mistake for trying to save money.
customer_reviews.author: Vaschakas

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated after a 6 month mild Tennesse winter with no snow or wind
customer_reviews.text: We put this cover on our trailer in the fall. Mild winter, no snow and hardly any wind. Just uncovered it and it literally fell apart in our hands. The top was totally disintegrated from the sun. It was paper thin and falling apart into dust as we removed it from the trailer. Straight into the trash can after 6 months. Looking for something better now.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Owner

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money! Been through 2 of them!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this cover in 2018, seemed to be well made and did the job before it ripped. Amazon replaced it once after the first time and now I'm dealing with dealer to get a second replacement as amazon wont replace it again. I followed all the instructions, padded the sharp areas with duct tape and pool noodles prior to placing it on the camper. Please look at another cover as you will be wasting your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: KBomb

customer_reviews.title: I am sure it will work fine, we will know next Spring when we open ...
customer_reviews.text: We weren't as impressed with the quality and although we went with the sizing suggestions, it is not an accurate fit (too big which made it difficult for strapping it down correctly). None the less it does the job to cover our camper and we didn't want to wait for the return process and reordering as winter weather was approaching. I am sure it will work fine, we will know next Spring when we open up the camper once again. I'll give an updated review then.
customer_reviews.author: Brook Waters

customer_reviews.title: excellent cover, hands down better than elements brand
customer_reviews.text: excellent cover, hands down better than elements brand. made it through first winter with minimal wear. wish they all came with gutter pockets, that would be a perfect cover. will buy again! if the price is right!! Elements lasted 4 months, was ripped to shreds, they replaced it under warranty and same thing happened. this one will get another season easy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cover fits
customer_reviews.text: There is no easy way to install a cover on a travel trailer. One is 11 feet off the ground and the cover is cumbersome. I think it will do the job. The jury is out as to water resistance and durability because one needs a bunch of seasons to know the answer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Fit our 20' campter like a glove
customer_reviews.text: This travel trailer camper cover provided excellent protection for our 20' travel trailer, it was relatively easy to install and covered the camper in an excellent manner. We also liked the feature that enabled us to unzip the cover to access the unit to complete our weatherization and storage and to fix an alarm that was sounding.
customer_reviews.author: DawgsMa

customer_reviews.title: very weak fabric
customer_reviews.text: I'm NOT happy with this product at all. I have only had it on my trailer for a few months in the pacific northwest; I was being VERY careful one day to carefully take it off before going camping. it got lightly snagged on the corner of my awning rail and tore a good gash in the fabric; simple as a razor thru like tinfoil. very weak fabric
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight material
customer_reviews.text: Cover fits as advertised. Unfortunately the material is so lightweight it is virtually impossible to put this on your trailer without ripping it. Every trailer has edges around it that aren’t rounded, and this cover will not handle them. Despite three people putting on this cover with the utmost care, it now is repaired with duct tape. This truly is a one season cover.
customer_reviews.author: BlueDevil

customer_reviews.title: After a year and half if use.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2017, it has now started showing signs of wear. Was hoping to get at least two years and some change. The most visible is the front wear it's separating at the stitches. The material itself has been showing wear as in thinning and has been so bad is some places it's like tissue papers. Overall it's a nice looking cover but the wear is a little too premature, especially is California wear the weather is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: rekkoil

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this with a recommendation and it was a total disappointment!! We put it on our trailer and 4 months later it has deteriorated so badly we could hardly box it back up as requested and send it to Amazon. Thank you Amazon for the replacement which we aren’t expecting it to last but at least it’s something for now! Another complaint we have with the cover company is that my husband called to get information on how the warranty worked and he never got a call back after several calls! That is when we called Amazon and they backed us up. I would NEVER purchase another cover from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ADCO Designer Series Travel Trailer Cover
customer_reviews.text: Didn't take very long to put on and it fits my 2006 22H Nash travel trailer perfectly! The zipper on the side is very handy for getting into the trailer when you don't want to uncover the whole thing. The weighted clips that attach to the straps make shooting the straps under the trailer very easy. I was able to get the cover on the first time with almost no help. Time will tell if the cover holds up well against the elements.
customer_reviews.author: FlyGirl

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk. Purchased June 10th, while putting it on our trailer the cover is so thin, that it tore as my husband was fitting it on. The rip was small enough, I patched it and didn’t worry. Come end of August, we went to go pick up our trailer at the storage unit for an annual camping trip we do...while taking off the cover it was so brittle, pieces started disintegrating. Two months total this cover was used for..and it is complete trash already! Save your money, do not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: k_kam

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product last year in March 2017. Didn't put it on my camper until October 2017. It literally had ripped and torn over the winter. The camper wasn't under any trees. Can't believe this didn't last one season. Do not buy. Should have read the reviews better!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should. It covered my travel trailer ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. It covered my travel trailer as it was suppose to. It was easier than expected to put n. We did place a tarp over the top where the vents and air conditioner is so that the cover would not hang on the edges and rip. It is holding up quite well in the wind, rain and snow.
customer_reviews.author: cps

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but quality is poor
customer_reviews.text: Quality was terrible, lasted two months before first major rip and gradually deteriorated during the next few months. Every time we put it back on it would rip. Small gray flakes would come off consistently. Had to patch it with gorilla tape all the time. This is a great looking cover, but don’t experience ext it to last long if you use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Ripped withing the first 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 29 ft Travel trailer in March, installed in April. Pretty easy to install with two people and looked like a quality cover. Followed the directions on layout, padding, etc. We store our trailer in a locked storage facility, no trees. Got a note in July from the facility that the cover was coming apart. It has come apart and is off the trailer now (August). Called ADCO and waiting to see what their warranty response will be.
customer_reviews.author: Hondaguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and fits smallest size of range FYI
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, hope it lasts in Texas summer. Fit our trailer perfectly so I’d say it runs a bit small because we were at bottom size range. Had to climb on top and have 2 others help with sides. Edited 10/19- picked up trailer today and several clips are broken off and it has a large hole in it where it rubbed a section of the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Oc mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit
customer_reviews.text: This looked like a nice quality cover which we bought for our camper and the fit was excellent, however, 6 months later the roof of the cover had rotted making it useless. I have to say this was disappointing as the cover looked to be nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D

customer_reviews.title: Good customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Good cover construction with appealing look. I would not recommend this model for my area. The cover was damaged after 9 months in the high desert of California. It was covered by the factory warranty. Instead of a free replacement I upgraded to the ADCO 34843 Designer Series Gray/White 24' 1" - 26' DuPont Tyvek Travel Trailer Cover. Customer service was excellent. They only required a couple pictures and manufacturing date for the warranty claim. Fast response to the inquiry. Received the new cover within a week. Thank you ADCO.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We are impressed
customer_reviews.text: We just put this on our trailer about 5 weeks ago, for the winter. The fit and quality far exceeded other brands we have purchased in the past. It seems to be holding up well to wind so far, we'll see how the snow effects it! The tie downs were well done. Fabric seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: Used less than 3 months and the roof top is beginning to rip. I live in Southern CA with mild weather. Very disappointed since it looks great, fits well and has a bunch of handy hooks to tighten it down. i placed a tarp over the trailer top before putting the cover to eliminate any sharp corners or snags. Cover still fell apart. Bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Mom in West Covina

customer_reviews.title: This product won't last
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice looking but unfortunately doesn't hold up. See the pictures I attached. The first one is the day we installed it new on May 27, 2019. The next two are only 53 days later! It basically fell apart in multiple places. I called Adco's customer service a total of 3 times. More info - I am in Phoenix, AZ and there is no doubt that the sun is harsh, but again, the pictures are after only 53 days. When I was on the phone with Victoria she said they would give me purchase price credit toward a different product made of Sunbrella which was good with me.
customer_reviews.author: Todd K.

customer_reviews.title: The cover tears easily. Also the covers for the rain spouts are ...
customer_reviews.text: The cover tears easily. Also the covers for the rain spouts are no help at all. What did work, I used a tennis ball. I cut an x in the ball, pushed it onto the rain spout. It did a very good job protecting the cover. Gorilla tape helps with the tears. Placing the clear tape both on the front and rear of the tear. I think this cover will only last two years if l'm lucky. I will say ADCO makes a good wheel cover. I'd be willing to pay more for a more durable material. In the long run it would be more economical.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money and get something else !
customer_reviews.text: The material used in this cover should not even be considered durable! Even using the spout cap mesh bags, there were holes in this cover within two days. The corners are not reinforced and even the patch that it comes with peels off with ease. If you’re looking for a durable weather resistant Cover, do yourself a favor and look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: MARK J. TATASCIORE

customer_reviews.title: Roof fabric deteriorated after 2nd season
customer_reviews.text: The roof material powdered and fell apart after only 2 seasons. Sides are still in great shape aside from a few tears that are my fault. Easy to install and fits pretty good with some adjusting and snugging up on straps. Took longer to pack in storage bag than it did to install.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I figured the installation as best I could
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write product reviews, but I feel it necessary on this product. The cover arrived as promised, but upon opening the box I found no instructions in the box. I figured the installation as best I could, however the main gripe is the quality of the item, the first strap I pulled on came completely off the cover. It ripped a small patch from the external layer of the cover as well! I needed to use the cover before the rain and cold hit that night so I continued with the installation and will keep the item. Just wanted to give others a heads up as to the quality of this item.
customer_reviews.author: William H.

customer_reviews.title: First time use
customer_reviews.text: This appears well made and fits our 22 foot trailer pretty good. It comes with weighted throws to get the straps from one side to the other with minimum effort providing a nice snug fit. I'll try and update this review at the end of the winter as to how well it performed in protecting the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: BritBrat

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than one year. Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: Less than one year later and it has fallen apart completely! We have bought a cheap blue tarp every year in the past. You expect them to last one year and replace it. BUT when you spend this much on a “nice” RV cover you expect it to last. NOT SO! Purchased may 2017 picture taken July 2018. Terrible quality! We will go back to the cheap tarps.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart in 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: This cover has completely disintegrated from July 2019 to now. It’s has turned to a grey dust underneath and the front is now completely transparent to the point I can easily read the decals on the front cap of my trailer. I live in the San Joaquin region of the Central Valley of California. It does get hot in the summer here and the trailer is parked on the side of my house. I would expect more from a cover of this price point. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated in less than 5 months use...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this cover in the winter and began using it in late spring though summer. It disintegrated in less than 5 months. When I spoke to the company they said it is only designed for winter coverage. I pointed out that it advertised triple layer water shed and UV coverage. They did not have an answer for this. They offered, under the 2 year warranty a replacement and I’d have to pay $35 shipping or I can spent up to $500 more for their top of the line product + shipping. Completely disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Boyd

customer_reviews.title: This cover looks nice and fits well
customer_reviews.text: This cover looks nice and fits well. The problem with it is that it has already worn out after 1 year of use. The fabric is VERY thin and this will need to be replaced within the next year. DO NOT BUY if you expect this to last longer than about 2 years...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Haggar

customer_reviews.title: Not a happy camper
customer_reviews.text: We received this with no directions, that would have been very helpful. I would say that it has approximately 10 holes in it that I duct taped underneath so you couldn't see it after my husband and I put it on. I loved the looks of this cover on line but after the trouble we had I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: buster61

customer_reviews.title: Ripped down the center in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item January 2018 and it was completely falling apart by January 2019. We tried to fix it with tape and sewing, but it has deteriorated as if it was dry rotted. We live in a modest climate in KY, no abnormally harsh weather in the summer or winter. It ripped completely down the center of the cover, not even from a weak corner.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: No Bueno
customer_reviews.text: I have had to buy several RV covers over the years with each lasting typically 3 to 5 years. I am very dissatisfied with this product as just like many of the other reviewers have said, it tore in the first year. I can't imagine this cover lasting any longer than one season anywhere if it can't survive one year in Seattle's moderate weather. Definately a do not buy rating
customer_reviews.author: Buck Huntin

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT keep dirt off your camper!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cover because we park our camper under oak trees and wanted to protect the roof from dirt and sap. We covered it during the winter months and when we opened it up for spring the roof was completely black! This cover did absolutely nothing to keep the dirt off our roof! What a complete waste of money! The cover was very clean on the outside and totally dirty underneath. It’s like it let all the dirt to pass right through to the camper! Would NOT recommend you purchase this cover!
customer_reviews.author: levihunts

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality materials just like every other RV cover
customer_reviews.text: ADCO covers are made from materials that recycled shopping bags are made from so it rips with ease. The cover is light weight so this helps when putting it on the trailer. You have to make sure it is secured firmly because if any wind moves it then it will have rips all over. First week I had it I had about 8-10 6 inch rips. Unfortunately, the RV cover industry lacks quality overall and this is the standard so you will have to buy more products over and over again - pretty much a scam by these companies.
customer_reviews.author: Nida Lopez

customer_reviews.title: This is a light weight cover that comes with straps, a bag for storage.
customer_reviews.text: The material on this was not as strong as I would had liked it to be.. It kept its colors for two years and looked very good with minimal fading. I have replaced the trailer that I had this on and will definitely be getting a new one for my new trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Lonnie

customer_reviews.title: Great camper cover.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice camper cover. It is very sturdy and well made. The cover looks nice on our camper. It completely covers our camper so it is more secure. We previously used a tarp to cover the top of the camper during off seasons, and they always tore off and shredded badly in the wind. Sometimes we had to replace it two or three times a season, so we spent a lot of money. This cover was a great price, and less than the cost of the tarps we purchased each season. The company is very nice and a pleasure to do business with.
customer_reviews.author: MaryM

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this cover! Cover only lasted 7 months ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this cover! Cover only lasted 7 months before I put my hand through the top material. I live in Southern California where the weather is relatively mild. When I called to get a new one, I was told that they had upgrades for an extra $100. I asked what the warranty was and was told it was two years. I then asked what the guarantee was that it wouldn't rip again in six months and was told that there's no guarantee. They can't even guarantee that their product will last a year!
customer_reviews.author: Chub

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Just put it on for year two. As we put it on we did not see any fading or discoloration from the previous year. We live in Northern Idaho, in an area that gets a lot of snow. Last year there was at least 3 to 4 (at times) feet on this cover and it performed great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely pleases with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: So after purchasing a brand new trailer I was concerned with premature aging due to sun fading and damage from UV rays. We live in sunny and hot California. This is a very nice cover and we love the protection from the elements this cover provides - it fits our 30 foot travel trailer perfect! A very nicely made cover, and we love the access zippers on the side that provides access to the trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory A. Gaxiola

customer_reviews.title: Good cover great price
customer_reviews.text: Great cover fit my trailer perfect. Good price too. I contacted a local shop that sells this and they wanted almost 2x what I paid. Camping world sells this too for a lot more. Has already been through a torrential downpour and sheds the water off the rv nicely. Seems to be pretty durable, just make sure you don't have any of the corners or edges of the cover against any metal or jagged edge it could rip on.
customer_reviews.author: Ted S.

customer_reviews.title: Great looking cover
customer_reviews.text: Great looking cover . Corners ripped in less than 3 months . I had all the straps tight as instructed to do . It would be expensive to buy this every year.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Porter

customer_reviews.title: Great cover, great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice cover & sized well. The price is substantially less than going through Camping World or one of the other major dealers. It is worth every penny considering the protection it offers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!!! Pay for indoor storage.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap piece of garbage. The material is thin it ripped trying to get it on. The buckles will brake they are very weak plastic. I have a feeling I will be getting a call about the wind ripping it off.
customer_reviews.author: amievl

customer_reviews.title: Disintegrated in less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget a ladder when you try to put it on! I had to come back to edit this review, because the trailer storage owner called me to say my cover was completely off of my trailer - and I went and found it around the bottom like a skirt! The top had completely torn and disintegrated, and had white stuff all over it, and was like a tree skirt around the bottom. Complete waste of money and I had it less than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Chieco

customer_reviews.title: Easy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Survived several storms this season without any tears or issues. Installation was pretty straightforward. I would recommend leaving it rolled up and unrolling it on the roof. I was able to install by myself thanks to some intelligently designed strap weights.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Cardoza

customer_reviews.title: Good covers are more expensive than this.
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years, not designed for So Cal they said. They did give me a replacement with no guarantee. I thought i was spending good money on something that would last. They offered an upgrade i could not choke down the cost
customer_reviews.author: Doug

product_meta.title: ADCO 52245 Designer Series SFS Aqua Shed Travel Trailer RV Cover - 28'7" - 31'6" , Gray
product_meta.description: Size:28'7" - 31' 6 "Protect your Travel Trailer with ADCO's Designer Series SFS AquaShed RV Cover. Designed for moderate climates with high moisture. Features triple layer SFS AquaShed top panel and triple layer designer polypropylene sides with a contemporary aesthetic unique to ADCO. Significantly reduces premature aging of RV and helps maintain resale value. Keeps Roof clean to reduce black-streaks from forming on sides of RV. Reduces need for washing, waxing and roof treatments. Protection against harmful UV rays that can cause unwanted cracking and fading on your RV. Multiple Passenger-side zipper entry doors for easy covered access. Reinforcements throughout cover significantly reduce snags & tears. Reinforced Buckles, Flaps and Straps resist rip-out. Built-in Vents allow air to escape the cover in moderate winds. Roof fabric partially extends down the front, back and sides of the cover for extra protection. Front, rear and bottom buckle cinching system removes slack and prevents billowing. Color is Gray on Top with Gray Sides. Features ADCO's 2 year manufacturer warranty. Includes: Rain gutter spout protectors to prevent cover puncture (We highly recommend using these on travel trailers in particular). Storage bag. Ladder Cap to prevent contact with cover. Extra adhesive reinforcement material. Weighted buckle toss-under for easy installation. Why SFS AquaShed? Multi-layer composition includes microporous film that repels water but allows air to penetrate. Soft to the touch yet durable. Moderate UV stability (For High UV climates, we recommend our Designer Series Tyvek products). This fabric is a great value for it's price point. How to Buy the Best fitting cover for your travel trailer? Measure from the longest two points including bumpers and ladder but excluding hitch to determine proper size needed.It has been highly recommended for moderate climates and short term storage.
feature_bullets: Length 28 feet 7 inches, 31 feet 6 inches (381 inches x 104 inches x 102 inches) and this cover ACcommodates for: All types of front ends, Air conditioners, extra tall and regular height walls, slide outs and ladders
Protect your travel trailer with ADCO’s designer series SFS aqua shed RV cover
Designed for moderate climates with high moisture
Features triple layer sfs aquashed top panel and triple layer designer polypropylene sides with a contemporary aesthetic unique to ADCO
Significantly reduces premature aging of RV and helps maintain resale value

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,567 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
